input_text:
Job Title: Associate Mechanical Engineer

Location: San Jose, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
About Visby

Visby Medical is an ambitious, well-funded late-stage biotech startup. Driven by a belief that infectious disease diagnosis should be quick, accurate, and accessible to all, Visby has developed the world’s first single-use PCR platform that disrupts the traditional model and redefines the way infectious disease is tested and treated.

About The Role

The Associate Mechanical Engineer will support the Engineering team in the development and testing of disposable medical diagnostic devices, as well as help maintain the R&D engineering workspace at the Visby Headquarters. The candidate will work with a team of engineers and scientists from multiple disciples and shall have a broad range of responsibilities.

How You'll Make An Impact

Utilize rapid prototyping methods and equipment to aid in development and testing of a mechanical and fluidic systems.Assemble test units, diagnose and document assembly issues.Participate in failure and root cause analysis of mechanical assemblies.Assemble and trouble-shoot fixtures used for manufacture and inspection of parts.Hands-on transfer of processes to manufacturing and operations team.Maintain an orderly and clean work area, equipment and materials.Execute test protocols and experiments.Write test reports.Execute re-work and inspection of components.Use computers, sensors, and instrumentation to gather and record data.Other duties as assigned.


On your first day we'd like you to have

0-2 years of industry experience.BS degree in an engineering or industrial design discipline required.


Preferred Qualifications

Good working knowledge of rapid prototyping methods – 3D printing, laser cutting, silicone casting, manual or CNC machining.Solid understanding of fundamental physics.Experience following experimental protocols and conducting experiments in lab setting a strong plus. Experience with dimensional inspection and metrology a plus.Excellent hands-on assembly skills, including soldering of electronic components a plus.Background in life sciences a plus.Problem solving and attention to detail.Ability to follow instructions and work with minimal supervision.Willingness to learn new methods and technologies.


Physical demands

Comfortable performing repetitive tasks and/or motions.Must be able to lift a minimum of 10 lbs


Salary Range:

$83,054 - $103,818 (salary range for candidates based in San Jose, CA)Compensation for the role is based on geographical location. Should the level or location of the role change during the hiring process, the applicable base pay range may be updated accordingly.Compensation also depends on a number of factors including a candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies and experience and may fall outside of the range shown.


More About Our Benefits

Visby offers highly competitive health insurance through Cigna or Kaiser, including a company-funded HSA option. We also offer a 401k match, flexible paid time off, 11 company holidays, and many other contemporary benefits and perks.

Additional Information

We believe that the unique contributions of all Visbees is the driver of our success. To make sure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience we never discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, pregnancy or related medical conditions, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, or military or veteran status.

Full COVID Vaccination Required - Reasonable accommodations for medical or religious reasons considered.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
